items.desc: Many photojournalists adopt the style of Henri-Cartier Bresson and other photographers: using small 35mm cameras to capture images of life as it occurred rather than staged portraits.

items.startDesc: Cameras become more prevalent in society, as does film development
items.endDesc: Film cameras slowly become superseded by digital ones

items.startDesc: Photoshop is released for Macintosh for $895. It took a few years for it to be released to Windows (1993) and thus the mass market and global reach. It quickly became the industry standard in digital colour editing.
FUJIX DS-X is the first mass-market digital camera.
The first iPhone is released with a 2MP rear camera with geotagging.
Reddit user 'deepfake' coins the term for synthetic media where a person in an image or video is swapped with another person's likeness.
